Topic.Title: Tegra 3 still bringing home the bacon, 18 months after its launch

Message.Msg: Thanks for the update. Some idiots here write Tegra off like it died months or years ago. Glad to see the new design wins. The truth is NVIDIA has got a multi sku mobile strategy, and these things take time to develop. Tegra3 will probably still be winning new designs when Tegra5 starts shipping. Good, better, best at different price points, it's really quite simple.

Message.Title: DOW and NAS sllightly down this morn yet
Message.Msg: NVDA takes a hit....down almost 3%. Puts, calls, Leaps who cares this stock is a worthless performer. Longs are brutalized while shorts maybe be rewarded. Stay away from NVDA if investing is your game. This stock isn't it. They need new top management a complete overhaul. Jen would do stockholders a favor by putting the company up for sale or take it private. Performance for the past couple years is truly disappointing, ENOUGH!

Message.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings
Message.Msg: Jonathan Pitzer of Credit Suisse, one of two analysts downgrading the stock today, cut his rating on the shares to Underperform from Neutral, writing that ” Profitability, unfortunately, continues to be challenging – the bullish upside scenario assumed gaming alone could contribute annualized earnings of $0.40+ based on $1.5bn in revenue and OpM of 20%.” “However, OpM on gaming appears to be closer to 10% than 20% – and our analysis suggests annualized earnings in a bullish scenario of only $0.20.” AMD currently down 13%

Topic.Title: IT Suks to be a NVDA shareholder.

Message.Msg: I know. I used to be an investor on Nvidia in early 2011 at $14.20. But, back in Nov 2011 I finally realized that this stock wasn't going anywhere and with the added headwind of declining PC sales where Nvidia GPUs were heavily depended on I’ve decided to get out at $14.40 (tiny profit) and bought BAC (Bank of America) at $5.60 instead. Today, my BAC shares are approaching $15 while NVDA still hovering $14.10-$14.20.

Topic.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings

Message.Msg: If gaming contributes only $0.20 annualized, it will be interesting to see if it is enough to swing them into the black. It is not clear that will be enough, unless a lot of other things change. Their extremely limited traction in tablets, the erosion of the low end of the PC market, where their products have traditionally found favor, and the much anticipated expectation of the slow decline of the discrete market don't bode well.

Topic.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings

Message.Msg: AMD stated in its earnings report that their bread-n-butter business - the Computing Solutions division - sees a decline of shipments plus ASP decrease, sequentially and y/y. Yet Rory Read promises a whopping 22% revenue increase all on game consoles. Several tech websites expressed unveiled skepticism about this promise; Engadget etc

The stock could jump nicely if NVidia can actually deliver on-time... However, the stock has moved from the 12s to 14s with the stock buyback..

Topic.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings

Message.Msg: Maybe AMD might make that revenue with initial demand but how sustainable will it be after the holiday season is finished in 2014 ?

Topic.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings

Message.Msg: Agreed, Rory may deliver for Q3 by putting all eggs in one basket, but sustaining it would be a problem. Most of the gamers (at least a half) who plan to purchase a new XBOX One or PS4 would do so during the holiday seasons plus/minus a couple of months. After that, there would be a price reduction..... The trajectory for selling game consoles is no longer the same as six years ago, with the proliferation of high-end smartphones and tablets. Not to mention the new micro game consoles including Shield.

Topic.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings

Message.Msg: Shield vs AMD Jaguar consoles ... Shield performs quite well on a cpu to cpu comparison to Jaguar at least in single-thread, Jaguar has 8 cores vs 4 for Shield. browserDOTprimatelabsDOTcom/geekbench2/compare/2025974/2139838 Two caveats when viewing the above comparison, Jaguar's clockspeed in the consoles is reputed to be 1.6 GHz not 1.5 GHz and also the Geekbench author has publicly said that the blur and sharpen image subtests are broken for x86 (as they force precise denormal handling via the slower but more accurate 80-bit x87 unit) and will not be fixed until Geekbench 3. Still a 1.9 GHz A15 is quite comparable to a 1.6 Ghz Jaguar across the board. The consoles gpus though have an order of magnitude more grunt than Shield but at low resolutions games are cpu bound.

Topic.Title: Credit Suisse comments on AMD earnings

Message.Msg: Ouch! on the gross margins for the game console business. Weren't there about a thousand posts from xc jeering Nvidia for declining the business. AMD is making more than Nvidia would have, and is still barely scraping by. The business is good for AMD, which needs it to survive, but it's more of a foul tip with two outs than a home run.

Message.Title: Toshiba to introduce 3rd Tegra 4 based tablet: Toshiba Regza AT703
Message.Msg: ""The Toshiba Regza AT703 is the latest tab that Toshiba is going to introduce. The Regza AT703 is a powerful tablet. It comes with latest NVIDIA’S Tegra 4 processor that is highly advanced processor as from from expert’s end. You can also use this AT703 tablet as notebook pc by adding its keyboard dock."" The other Tegra 4 based tablets are Toshiba Excite Pro and Toshiba Write - both are currently available at US retailers since this week. SOURCE: techswaveDOTcom/toshiba-regza-at703-tegra/

Message.Title: AMD dropped 13% despite rev beat - why were investors spooked?
Message.Msg: Margins. Margins. Margins - low double digits meaning 10% Barrons recorded a handful of analysts comments in this debate. BEARISH --Stacy Rasgon, Bernstein Research: Reiterates a Market Perform rating but raises his price target to $4 from $2. “While consoles appear to be adding materially to revenues, profitability was an unpleasant surprise, with expectations for “low double digit” operating margins. Given relatively little incremental opex, this suggests gross margins (at least for the moment) far below corporate average, materially limiting potential upside from this business [...] we have been very leery to take the bait1, particularly given the company has been hesitant to provide longer term margin guidance. And, last night we discovered that our hesitance to bite was in fact, warranted. Operating margins for the business were indicated in the “low double digits,” likely materially below investor expectations. A bit of mix analysis suggests gross margins for the initial console business somewhere in the ballpark of 20% next quarter. While we would be surprised to see margins stay here forever (presumably cost position should improve later in the ramp) we believe upside from the business is likely to be materially lower than some of the more bullish forecasts likely behind the stock’s recent run.” --Betsy Van Hees, Wedbush Securities: Reiterates a Neutral rating and raises her price target to $4.50 from $4. “We were impressed with the beat and raise, but believe much of the gaming console design wins are already priced in given the weakness in afterhours trading and 90+% gain YTD vs. 25+% of the SOX. We believe for meaningful appreciation in the stock from this level that we will need to see sell thru of game consoles, continued momentum in servers and notebooks, and traction in ultrathins, and tablets.” (To be continued)

Topic.Title: AMD dropped 13% despite rev beat - why were investors spooked?

Message.Msg: Part 2: --Ross Seymore, Deutsche Bank: Reiterates a Hold rating, and a $4 price target. “The co also delivered strong 3Q rev guidance (+22% q/q) as its APU wins within upcoming game consoles begin to ramp. Unfortunately, this revenue goodness is offset by much lowerthan-expected GMs. Consequently, our recently increased rev ests are rising a bit further, but our EPS ests fall (albeit still above original est). Overall, we applaud AMD’s 2Q execution and believe its gaming wins can stabilize cash flows, but we remain concerned that structural challenges in Computing are likely to re-emerge in 2H13/2014.” --Stephen Chin, UBS: Reiterates a Neutral rating, and a $4.50 price target. “We believe AMD has executed well on its transformation plan as it guided 3Q13 opex down -6% q/q to its stated goal of $450M while guiding 3Q13 up +22% q/q to profitability. We believe further P/E multiple expansion is possible if AMD can execute on its target of operating profitability and positive free cash flow in 2H13 [...] AMD guided 3Q13 gross margin to 36% which suggests its game console (GC) gross margin is around 25% (higher than our initial 20% estimate). AMD expects GC operating margins to be in the “low-teens” which is also higher than our prior estimate of 5%. Since AMD’s GC royalties from Microsoft and Nintendo (estimate $150M/year) will wind down as its GC APU chip sales ramp, we estimate its GC chip sales need to reach $1B in 2014 to improve graphics segment profitability.” BULLISH --Hans Mosesmann, Raymond James: Reiterates an Outperform rating on the shares, and a $5 price target. “There appears to be some debate this morning regarding whether AMD’s new console ramp with Microsoft’s Xbox One and Sony’s PlayStation 4 will be either neutral or accretive to overall earnings. (To be continued)

Topic.Title: AMD dropped 13% despite rev beat - why were investors spooked?

Message.Msg: Part 3: ...While the gross margin profile may have been a little below expectations for the initial ramp in 2H13, our research shows that the next generation of consoles is clearly incremental to overall earnings for AMD. Under the previous generation, AMD had GPU wins in both the Wii and Microsoft’s Xbox 360, with a royalty model generating a few dollars per unit. With the new generation, the Street seems to be missing that the relationship with Sony is entirely incremental, while the Xbox contribution is higher (CPU and GPU vs. just the GPU in the prior generation) and the Nintendo relationship remains the same. Moreover, average selling prices (ASPs) for the new semicustom APU shipments for the new Xbox and PlayStation are in the $60-100 range with operating margins in the low double digits. Thus, the operating profit dollar contribution under the new model is clearly higher.” Bobby Burleson, Canaccord Genuity: Reiterates a Buy rating, and raises his price target to $6 from $5. “We believe this turnaround story appears to have legs [...] AMD guided Q3 revenue to be up 22%, plus or minus 3% (midpoint of $1.42 billion) compared to our estimate of $1.29 billion and consensus estimate of $1.22 billion. Management guided gross margins to decline to the 36% level in Q3 with increasing mix of semi-custom gaming console chip sales. Operating expenses for the quarter are expected to be $450 million. Management expects inventory to increase to $800 million driven by gaming console semi-custom builds. AMD expects 2013 capital expenditure to be $150 million and expects taxes of $4 million per quarter.”
